Interface NumberSlider


  • public interface NumberSlider
    Created by Hans Dulimarta on Feb 08, 2016.

    • Method Detail

      • resizeBoard

        void resizeBoard(int height,
                 int width,
                 int winningValue)
        Reset the game logic to handle a board of a given dimension
        Parameters:
        height - the number of rows in the board
        width - the number of columns in the board
        winningValue - the value that must appear on the board to win the game
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the winning value is not power of two or negative

      • reset

        void reset()
        Remove all numbered tiles from the board and place TWO non-zero values at random location

      • setValues

        void setValues(int[][] ref)
        Set the game board to the desired values given in the 2D array. This method should use nested loops to copy each element from the provided array to your own internal array. Do not just assign the entire array object to your internal array object. Otherwise, your internal array may get corrupted by the array used in the JUnit test file. This method is mainly used by the JUnit tester.
        Parameters:
        ref -

      • placeRandomValue

        edu.gvsu.bonazzig.game1024.Cell placeRandomValue()
        Insert one random tile into an empty spot on the board.
        Returns:
        a Cell object with its row, column, and value attributes initialized properly
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the board has no empty cell

      • slide

        boolean slide(edu.gvsu.bonazzig.game1024.SlideDirection dir)
        Slide all the tiles in the board in the requested direction
        Parameters:
        dir - move direction of the tiles
        Returns:
        true when the board changes

      • getNonEmptyTiles

        java.util.ArrayList<edu.gvsu.bonazzig.game1024.Cell> getNonEmptyTiles()
        Returns:
        an arraylist of Cells. Each cell holds the (row,column) and value of a tile

      • getStatus

        edu.gvsu.bonazzig.game1024.GameStatus getStatus()
        Return the current state of the game
        Returns:
        one of the possible values of GameStatus enum

      • undo

        void undo()
        Undo the most recent action, i.e. restore the board to its previous state. Calling this method multiple times will ultimately restore the gam to the very first initial state of the board holding two random values. Further attempt to undo beyond this state will throw an IllegalStateException.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when undo is not possible
